programming: The process of writing computer programs.

URL: api bahut acche se samjh ay

Backend: Backend is another term used for background in programming

Front-end: The Front-end is the user interface of a computer or any device

Token: A token is the smallest individual unit in a program, often referring to a portion of a much larger data piece.

Machine language: machine language is a lowest-level programming language consisting of binary digits or bits that are read by computers.

argument: Arguments are said to be “passed” into a function, and functions are said to “take” arguments. Also known as a “parameter.”

array: a type of value that contains a sequence of other values

comment: arbitrary text written around code, but which is never run

compiler: a program that converts code into an executable, and checks that the syntax is correct.

constant: a variable that never changes its value.

crash: to cause a running program to stop due to an error

function: a piece of code that is not run until it is called

integer: a type of value that represents whole numbers

float: a type of value that represents numbers with fractional parts

object: a value created from a class

program: a full piece of software that is ready to be run

return: A function automatically returns once all of its code has been run

string: a type of value that represents text

variable: a named container for a single value

type: the kind or category of a value

loop: a piece of code that runs itself repeatedly.

method: a function that is attached to an object.

implement: to write all the code to complete something – usually a function or a class.

assignment: the act of putting a value into a variable.

html: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, which is the most widely used language on Web to develop web pages

node.js: Node.js is an open source server environment.

express: Express is a fast, assertive, essential and moderate web framework of Node.js

hapi: A rich framework for building applications and services
